connector.description:
Upload Files to Dropbox.

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `file` / `ce-file`: as the file name to upload

If the header is not set, the exchange ID is used as file name.

camel.kamelet.dropbox-sink.accessToken.name: camel.kamelet.dropbox-sink.accessToken
camel.kamelet.dropbox-sink.accessToken.description: The access Token to use to access Dropbox

camel.kamelet.dropbox-sink.remotePath.name: camel.kamelet.dropbox-sink.remotePath
camel.kamelet.dropbox-sink.remotePath.description: Original file or folder to work with

camel.kamelet.dropbox-sink.uploadMode.name: camel.kamelet.dropbox-sink.uploadMode
camel.kamelet.dropbox-sink.uploadMode.description: The uploading mode in case a file with the same name exists on Dropbox. Choose `add` or `force`. With `add`, the new file is renamed. With `force`, the existing file is overwritten.
